body.p: To convince her husband uses Lady Macbeth some devices.At first she uses rhetorical questions.Was the hope drunk?Wherein you dressed yourself?Hath it slept since?(l. 9-10). She asks him if this prospheryprophecy is his desire and underlines that she wishes it becomes truth.

p.s: She also says that she will wait until he acceptaccepts his prospheryprophecy and respectrespects it and his new destiny.
Letting I dare not wait upon I would(l. 18).
After that she brings up a metaphor Like the poor cat i'th'adage (l. 19) to showsshow him that without murdering he can't become king.
Or at first to showsshow him that he has to do something to become king.
He reacts with: I dare do all that may become a man (l. 21).

And tries to show her that she has to be quiet (l. 20) and he understands her saying and is willing to dare his desire, but he also says that who dares more is not a man anymore (l. 22) and shows her that he wants also that the prospheryprophecy becomes true but is not ready to do more than to wish it.
At this point Macbeth doesn't know about the murdering plan from Lady Macbeth.
But his arguments bringsbring Lady Macbeth the new basic for her next try to convince him.
At first she is angry about his reasons to don't follow a plan.
What beast was't then, that made you break this enterprise to me?(l. 23, 24).
But thanthen she says that this plan is the only way for him to become a man.
After that she gets very personal to him and talks about their deathdead child and the pain she get (ll. 30).
But she tells him this to show what she would do for this prospheryprophecy.
And dashed the brains out, had I sworn as you have done to this(l. 34f.).
With this she can convince him that the prospheryprophecy has to become true, but he is still afraid If we should fail? (l. 36).
She takes his fear with the murdering plan to show him that she has the plan under control and he only has to carry the plan out (ll. 40).
Now Macbeth is convinced but his only worry is that the chamberlains are totoo smart Bring forth men-children only (l. 51).
He is now ready for the plan and underlines it with ana metaphor False face must hide what the false heart doth know (l. 57).
It means that he has to hide what he intends to behind a false face.
But he also admits that the plan is evil and says he has a false heart.
The relationship between Macbeth and Lady Macbeth is marked by ana very dominant part from Lady Macbeth.
First of all she has a much bigger part to say and she gets to put Macbeth into the plan.
Lady Macbeth follows what she wants and convinced her husband to get what she wants.
I think she gets this through manipulation and puts him a lot under pressure with rhetorical questions he can think about and personal stuff he has to deal with.
She also shows him her love and loyalty, because she makes the plan up, takes his fear and supportsupports his prospheryprophecy.
I think it is kind of a feministicfeminist act Lady Macbeth playplays, because she is the dominant part and gets through Macbeth what she wants.
She has her husband full under control.
And this effectsaffects the relationship between them.
Also the deathdead child is an affecteffect on the relationship.
It is very personal and painfullpainful for both.
But the dominance from Lady Macbeth is also shown because of her arguments.
She takes their deathdead child as argument for her loyalty and convinces him with that.
All and all I think Lady Macbeth is a powerfullpowerful and manipulative part in their relationship.
Both of them speak in verse, which shows that they are in a higher position.
But the huge part from Lady Macbeth and her choice of words showsshow that in this scene she is in a higher position as Macbeth.
She has the conversation under control.
